headline: Does Duke’s Expanded US$103 Billion Grid Investment Plan Reshape The Bull Case For Duke Energy (DUK)?
summary: Duke Energy Corporation has reported its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, with revenue rising to US$7,938 million for the quarter and US$32.24 billion for the year, while full-year net income increased to US$4.97 billion and earnings per share reached US$6.31 from continuing operations. Alongside these earnings, Duke Energy raised its five-year capital plan to US$103 billion and extended its long-term earnings guidance through 2030, underscoring the scale of planned grid and...

content.title: Does Duke’s Expanded US$103 Billion Grid Investment Plan Reshape The Bull Case For Duke Energy (DUK)?
content.summary: Duke Energy Corporation has reported its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, with revenue rising to US$7,938 million for the quarter and US$32.24 billion for the year, while full-year net income increased to US$4.97 billion and earnings per share reached US$6.31 from continuing operations.
